data.title: LEFT BEHIND NBA SEASONS: Jason Richardson was one of the most explosive players the NBA has ever seen in his prime & one of the most...
data.meta_description:
1,816 likes, 36 comments - courtsidebuzzig on July 24, 2023: "LEFT BEHIND NBA SEASONS: Jason Richardson was one of the most explosive players the NBA has ever seen in his prime & one of the most underrated players of the 2000s, as he showed off in 2005-06 üê∞

Richardson averaged a career-high 23.2 PPG (13th in NBA) & proved he wasn‚Äôt ‚Äújust as dunker,‚Äù as he shot 38.4 3P% & 45 FG% ü™£ He also averaged 1.3 SPG & 0.5 BPG. 

The 2x Slam Dunk Contest champion was NEVER an All-Star & was often overshadowed by other great two-guards of his time, including Kobe Bryant, Vince Carter, Tracy McGrady, Dwyane Wade, Ray Allen, & Allen Iverson! 

Richardson‚Äôs best individual season was this one, 2005-06, but he also averaged 16.0 PPG on the ‚ÄúWe Believe‚Äù Warriors the next season, where he had to adjust his game to fit in with new additions that took the team to the next level. 

To this day, in 2023, Richardson is still throwing down windmill & reverse dunks in the BIG3 at 42 years old! üò≥

How would PRIME Jason Richardson fit in the NBA today? ü§î".
